personalInfo.splInterest: Playing and creating board games, music
personalInfo.clubAffl: Treesdale G&CC (Gibsonia, Pennsylvania, Sewickley Heights GC (Sewickley, Pennsylvania).

tourBios.exmtStatus: Conditional - Finished T74 at 2015 Web.com Tour Qualifying TournamenT
tourBios.carHigh:
2014: Finished T100 at the Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament in December. Opened with a 77 and closed with rounds of 68-69...Competed on various mini tours throughout the year. 

2012: Played in two Web.com Tour events, missing the cut at the Chiquita Classic and the Neediest Kids Championship.

 2009: Made his first two PGA TOUR starts in July, missing the cut at the John Deere Classic and U.S. Bank Championship in Milwaukee...In August, received an invitation as a first-team All-American to play in the Nationwide Children's Hospital Championship, his first Web.com Tour appearance (missed cut).
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Outstanding career at Marquette was highlighted by a school-record 11 career victories, including five as a senior. Had 24 top-five finishes in 48 college events. Ranked as high as No. 4 in the R&A's World Amateur Ranking. Was a first-team All-American in 2009 and an Honorable Mention All-American in both 2007 and 2008. Was named the Byron Nelson Award winner in 2009 and one of 10 Ben Hogan Award semifinalists that same year. Was Big East Conference Player of the Year in 2009. Also excelled in academics, having been named Cleveland Golf All-America Scholar in 2008 and 2009, among other accolades. Played on the 2009 U.S. Palmer Cup team...Won back-to-back Pennsylvania Open titles in 2007 and 2008...Won the Pennsylvania Amateur and was named Pennsylvania Golf Association Player of the Year in 2008...Was a decorated junior golfer in Pennsylvania. Ranked No. 1 in Future Collegians World Tour in 2004-05. Had four wins in six events. Was Western Pennsylvania Golf Association Player of the Year. Captained his Pine-Richland High School team to the Western Pennsylvania Interscholastic Athletic League titles in both 2004 and 2005.
tourBios.personal: Father is veteran golf journalist Gary Van Sickle, currently a senior writer for Sports Illustrated and Golf.com. Mother, Betsy, was formerly sports information director at Marquette...Attended Pine-Highland High School in Gibsonia, Pa...Lettered in basketball three years in high school. Pirates' shortstop Neil Walker was a teammate...Majored in Broadcast and Electronic Communications at Marquette...Past part-time jobs include Little League baseball umpire...First-tee intro song would be "Let It Go" by Idina Menzel...Earliest golf memory was playing golf with his dad at Yale GC at age five and finding a snapped-in-half Wilson driver in the waste can, "my first driver."...If not a pro golfer, would be a sportscaster...Biggest thrill in golf was joking with Arnold Palmer on the first tee of 2009 Palmer Cup at Cherry Hills CC in Colorado...Memorable thrill outside golf was hitting a three-pointer at the buzzer in high school to beat his school's archrival...Favorite course played is Oakmont CC (where he won the Western Pennsylvania Junior)...Other favorites include the Pittsburgh Pirates, Toronto Blue Jays and San Diego Chargers. Top TV show is "Miami Vice" and his favorite movies are "The Sting" and "Good Will Hunting." Is a big fan of Andrew McMahon and Duncan Sheik (entertainers) and likes the book, Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy. Favorite athlete is Neil Walker and Milwaukee and Nantucket are cities he enjoys visiting...Best sporting event attended was the October 2014 Pirates' wild card game loss to the San Francisco Giants at PNC Park...Dream foursome would include his dad, Harry Truman and Shooter McGavin...Not many people know he has a pin in his left arm...Wife is finishing studies to be a nurse anesthetist...Threw out the first pitch at a Milwaukee Brewers game his senior year at Marquette...Has played almost 500 courses in 34 states...Twitter name is mvs_golf.

tourBios.carHigh: 2015: Finished T20 at the Bayview Place Island Savings Open, thanks to a closing-round 64...Held the third-round lead at the Staal Foundation Open with a front-nine 30 before finishing T14...Carded four rounds in the 60s to T10 at the ATB Financial Classic...Birdied three of his final four holes at the Cape Breton Open to post the clubhouse lead at 18-under, missing out on a playoff by one to finish solo third...Ranked 27th on the Order of Merit.
